WorkItem.Description:
Currently it seems to be showing in rawr.bear as 1.4 PPM but from what I can find its generally accepted as being 1.0 PPM. Apologies if I missed a dicussion that disproved the 1.0 PPM value somewhere but as it stands Windwalk is being overrated by rawr.bear I think. Unfortunately I dont think I can edit enchants as I can items so I cant check if it would still be best MH enchant with a 1.0 PPM.
 
I presume the other Windwalk is an older implementation (showing as 10% proc with 45 ICD)?
 
Not a high priority thing but would like to know if its worth the cost of Windwalk over 130 agility at present (and my maths ability is slightly lackluster).

Comments.Message: Can you provide proof as to where they discussed the change from 1.4 PPM to 1.0 PPM?
Sorry maybe I worded it badly. I can't actually find anywhere that said it is 1.4PPM other than rawr. I'll have a hunt for places I found that claimed it to be 1.0PPM and link when I find them again.

Referenced a couple of times on EJ (e.g. http://elitistjerks.com/f76/t110338-cataclysm_tanking_protection_field_manual_updated_jan_13_2011_4_0_3a/p2/#post1819842) and wowhead (although ofc thats hardly a theorycrafting website) but all places I've found so far refer back to tankadin: http://maintankadin.failsafedesign.com/forum/index.php?f=6&t=29319&rb_v=viewtopic

The tankadin thread itself was started back in 4.0 beta but is still being updated now. Can't find anywhere that thinks it is anything other than 1.0PPM (which I believe is a pretty standard PPM value for enchants?). 1.4 PPM seems a very odd value for Blizzard to have used (not that Blizzard are averse to stupid values ofc). 

I'm certain rawr sourced its PPM value from somewhere, did you have a link to where that value was found I could take a peek at?

I suspect the issue here maybe my lack of understanding of the PPM value in rawr. Although with autoattacks Windwalk may indeed have a proc chance of 1PPM (as specified in some places), presumably the PPM value in rawr actually takes into account special attacks as well? Perhaps thats why there is a difference to what I was expecting?
Based on my own testing, it is 1.4, even as of last night.

Okay. Not sure why others think its 1.0PPM. Maybe it was buffed post those investigations since it was deemed a bit lacklustre at first. May as well close this then. Apologies if i've wasted peoples time. Might have been better to raise it as a question on the forum rather than an issue.
No, not at all, this was perfect.
